text: Sosthenis () was a town in Oetaea in ancient Thessaly. The town's name appears in an epigraph dated to , as providing a treasurer on behalf of the Aetolians in making an alliance with the Acarnanians. Modern scholars tentatively locate Sosthenis at the modern site of Vardates. ==References== Category:Populated places in ancient Thessaly Category:Former populated places in Greece Category:Oetaea
title: Sosthenis
